name: project-init-starter
description: A repo-scoped baseline for teams: consistent prompts and templates for onboarding, PRs, reviews, tests, security checks, and releases (designed to be referenced in docs and CI).
author: promptg-team

templates.name: repo-onboarding-quickstart
templates.description: Generate a repo onboarding quickstart: setup, run, test, and contribute.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Create a repo onboarding quickstart that a new contributor can follow.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Setup, Run, Test, Contribute, Notes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Setup <= 10 bullets; Run <= 8 bullets; Test <= 8 bullets; Contribute <= 8 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are writing repo-specific onboarding for new contributors.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Repo context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Use the repo context (README snippets, setup notes, scripts, conventions) to produce a quickstart that is concrete, sequential, and copy/paste-friendly where possible.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., assume macOS, keep it short). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-pr-description
templates.description: Produce a PR description in the repo's expected format (what/why/how/testing/risk).
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Write a PR description in this repo's expected format.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, What Changed, Why, How To Test, Risks, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; What Changed <= 8 bullets; Why <= 6 bullets; How To Test <= 10 bullets; Risks <= 6 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You write PR descriptions that match the repository's conventions.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; repo PR template, standards, tickets, rollout notes): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Produce a reviewer-friendly PR description. If repo-specific format rules are provided in Context, follow them; otherwise use a reasonable default aligned with the section headings.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., focus on rollout/testing, keep it shorter). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-pr-review
templates.description: Self-review a PR diff against repo standards, risks, and acceptance criteria.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Self-review the change against repo standards and acceptance criteria.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Standards & Acceptance, Top Risks, Suggested Fixes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Standards & Acceptance <= 8 bullets; Top Risks <= 8 bullets; Suggested Fixes <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are doing a high-signal self-review before requesting review.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; repo standards, acceptance criteria, checklists): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Review the diff and identify gaps against repo standards and acceptance criteria, plus the top correctness/security/operability risks. Propose minimal, concrete fixes.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., only security, only operability, no refactors). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-commit-message
templates.description: Draft commit messages that match the repo's conventions and scope style.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Draft a commit message that matches this repo's conventions and scope style.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Subject, Body, Footers, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Subject is 1 line <= 72 chars; Body <= 6 lines; Footers <= 4 lines; Notes <= 4 bullets

Role:
You write commit messages that match repo conventions.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; repo commit style rules, ticket refs, intent): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Infer intent from the diff and produce a commit message that fits the repo's conventions. Use context to match scope/type rules when provided.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., include ticket refs, keep it very short). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-test-plan
templates.description: Plan testing for a change in this repo, focusing on regression and risk.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Plan testing for this change with a focus on regression and risk.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Risk Areas, Prioritized Test Cases, Coverage Notes, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Risk Areas <= 8 bullets; Prioritized Test Cases <= 12 bullets; Coverage Notes <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You write repo-appropriate test plans.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; repo test setup, environments, known risk areas): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Create a test plan with prioritized cases (P0/P1/P2) and expected results. Use Context to align with repo test commands/environments and known risk areas.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., smoke only, regression only, no e2e). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-security-scan
templates.description: Review repo changes for security risks, assumptions, and mitigations.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Review the change for security risks and recommend practical mitigations.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Findings, Mitigations, Assumptions, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Findings <= 8 bullets; Mitigations <= 8 bullets; Assumptions <= 6 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a pragmatic security reviewer for this repository.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; threat model, auth boundaries, data sensitivity): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Identify likely security issues in the change. In Findings, prefix each bullet with [Critical]/[High]/[Medium]/[Low] and include short evidence from the diff when possible. State any assumptions explicitly.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., auth only, injection only). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: repo-feature-plan
templates.description: Create a repo-appropriate feature plan including rollout and operational considerations.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Turn this feature request into a repo-appropriate plan, including rollout and operational considerations.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Scope, Approach, Tasks, Rollout, Operational Considerations, Risks, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Scope <= 8 bullets; Approach <= 8 bullets; Tasks <= 12 bullets; Rollout <= 8 bullets; Operational Considerations <= 8 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are planning work in this repository with an eye on operability.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Feature request / requirements (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Turn the request into an implementable plan tailored to this repo. Include rollout steps and operational concerns (monitoring, migration, failure modes) where relevant.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., MVP only, no schema changes). It cannot add output sections.
